thread.title: Middletown native Schwarber sets Cubs postseason home run record
thread.title_full: Middletown native Schwarber sets Cubs postseason home run record

title: Middletown native Schwarber sets Cubs postseason home run record
text:
Posted: 4:28 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 Middletown native Schwarber sets Cubs postseason home run record Related View Larger CHICAGO, IL - OCTOBER 13: Kyle Schwarber #12 of the Chicago Cubs points to the dugout after hitting a solo home run in the seventh inning against the St. Louis Cardinals during game four of the National League Division Series at Wrigley Field on October 13, 2015 in Chicago, Illinois. (Photo by Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images) View Larger CHICAGO, IL - OCTOBER 20: Kyle Schwarber #12 of the Chicago Cubs hits a solo home run in the first inning against Jacob deGrom #48 of the New York Mets during game three of the 2015 MLB National League Championship Series at Wrigley Field on October 20, 2015 in Chicago, Illinois. (Photo by David Banks/Getty Images) Staff Report 
Middletown High School grad Kyle Schwarber set a Chicago Cubs record Tuesday night in the National League Championship Series. 
Schwarber, a 22-year-old rookie catcher/outfielder, cranked a solo shot off New York’s Jacob deGrom in the first inning of a 5-2 loss in Game 3 to become the Cubs all-time home run leader for a single postseason. The home run was Schwarber’s fifth of the playoffs. 
The Mets lead the series 3-0. 
“I’m not really looking at that right now,” Schwarber told mlb.com. “I’m focused on winning ballgames, plain and simple. There’s no ‘I’ here. This is a team, plain and simple. I’m focused on making sure we play hard and get a win [Wednesday].” 
Schwarber was a first-round draft pick of the Cubs in 2014. 
Game 4 is at 8 p.m. Wednesday. More News
